meta_description: Losing the traditional doctrine of hell will mean the loss of souls along with it. Doubting hell is playing with eternal fire.
meta_title: Making Sense of Hell - The Gospel Coalition
title: Making Sense of Hell

body: An interesting read so far, thanks for sharing ColonialCandle. My understanding differs from what is expressed by Robert Golding on the topic, they source a great many proposed ideas by well read sources though. It all seems to serve to focus people to stay in the light of God and Jesus.
body_html: An interesting read so far, thanks for sharing ColonialCandle. My understanding differs from what is expressed by Robert Golding on the topic, they source a great many proposed ideas by well read sources though. It all seems to serve to focus people to stay in the light of God and Jesus.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body: It doesn't exist. Anyone familiar with the history of the time period when the Bible was composed will know this. The closest thing we have to a hell from early times is that some universalists believed in a purgatorial hell. Rome (shockingly) was the first to make up hell and it was a very valuable tool to control people. Protestants later did away with purgatory but not hell because they read their pre-existing Catholic notions into the text. Even this article admits they use hell to scare people into listening to them and that's why they're worried about it being exposed. So it's no surprise that their "support" is almost all theologians from the past couple centuries. I've been duped myself by several false teachers by the "if you don't listen to me you're going to hell!" message, it's an effective strategy.
body_html: It doesn't exist. Anyone familiar with the history of the time period when the Bible was composed will know this. The closest thing we have to a hell from early times is that some universalists believed in a purgatorial hell. Rome (shockingly) was the first to make up hell and it was a very valuable tool to control people. Protestants later did away with purgatory but not hell because they read their pre-existing Catholic notions into the text. Even this article admits they use hell to scare people into listening to them and that's why they're worried about it being exposed. So it's no surprise that their "support" is almost all theologians from the past couple centuries. I've been duped myself by several false teachers by the "if you don't listen to me you're going to hell!" message, it's an effective strategy.
